posts.title: Golgotha
posts.excerpt: Golgotha is noteworthy because it is the very first sound-picture ever made about Jesust. On top of that, it is thoroughly well done and engrossing. It starred a cast of hundreds—perhaps the biggest ever assembled for a film at the time. Like Cecil B. DeMille’s 1927 film King of Kings, Duvivier gives his film a …

posts._title: Mohammed Lakhdar-Hamina – Chronique des annees de braise AKA Chronicle of the Years of Fire (1975)
posts.title: Chronique des annees de braise
posts.excerpt: Quote: As exciting as any Hollywood epic, Chronicles of the Years of Embers follows a poor peasant from his drought-stricken village through his first encounters with colonialism, his service in the French army in World War II and finally his participation in the nascent Algerian resistance movement. Rich and inventive, this wide-screen epic is an …
posts.titleEnglish: Chronicle of the Years of Fire

posts.title: On Hitler’s Highway
posts.excerpt: A very personal journey, almost like a diary, with hand held camera Kowalski travels along the oldest highway in Polan, built by Hitler. While travelling along the highway Kowalski meets the people that now ply their trade their. The the director uses his camera to cut a swath through Hitler’s legacy from a new perspective.

posts._title: Yasujiro Ozu – Todake no kyodai AKA The Brothers and Sisters of the Toda Family (1941)
posts.title: Todake no kyodai
posts.excerpt: Synopsis The first box-office hit for Ozu in Japan, “The Brothers And Sisters Of The Toda Family” anticipates the later masterpieces such as “Tokyo Story” and “The End Of Summer”. After the death of the father of an upper-class family, his wife and daughter have to struggle to survive. Tensions arise when they moved in …
posts.titleEnglish: The Brothers and Sisters of the Toda Family

posts.title: Cinema Komunisto
posts.excerpt: Quote: When history has a different script from the one in your films, who wouldn’t invent a country to fool themselves? The collapsing sets of Tito’s Hollywood of the East take us on a journey through the rise and fall of the illusion called Yugoslavia. Exploring the ruins of the forgotten film sets and talking …

posts._title: Jean Garret – A Mulher Que Inventou o Amor AKA The Woman Who Invented the Love (1979)
posts.title: A Mulher Que Inventou o Amor
posts.excerpt: Doralice is a simple minded woman romantically fascinated by marriage. However, after being raped by a butcher and loses her virginity, a friend advises her to become a prostitute – and she does it. After that, all her wishes and longings will curl up into a fascinating vortex.
posts.titleEnglish: The Woman Who Invented the Love

posts._title: Satsuo Yamamoto – Shiroi Kyotô AKA The Great White Tower AKA The Ivory Tower (1966)
posts.title: Shiroi Kyotô
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Zaizen Goro may only be an assistant professor but he has already made a name for himself. His superior, however, does not approve of his attitude towards their profession, and is at odds over who to nominate as his successor. The selection of the new professor reveals a rich and complex political world inside …
posts.titleEnglish: The Great White Tower AKA The Ivory Tower

posts._title: Giuseppe M. Gaudino – Per amor vostro AKA For Your Love (2015)
posts.title: Per amor vostro
posts.excerpt: The film is built around Anna (Valeria Golino), a woman who has become so disconnected from life she can only see in grey. She works as a television show prompter, and is by all accounts pretty good at her job. She also has a comfortable existence and several children who love her. The same cannot …

posts.title: Mercedes
posts.excerpt: Science, it’s technical use, the breaking of social bonds, it’s rules – that’s the experiment’s name. Sakko and Oi meet by chance. She’s a casual prostitute, he’s unemployed. They’re the experimental subjects. A play about free time, our time, and unemployment. Mercedes is the adaptation of Brasch’s own play by the same title. It was …

posts.title: Our Stars
posts.excerpt: Stars of the 1940s and 1950s, were they cast for their mutual affinities or for their commercial appeal? If and when they were re-starred years later, did the magic still work? Did sparks still fly? The movie business, a machine that manufactured romance and desire at the same time that it documented the process of …
